result.execSummary:
The defendant Melody A. Holleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of letter regarding treatment submitted by Defense at teh 9/8/16 Sentencing Hearing

Case called at 2:31pm [MA]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Ms. Holleman

On Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, and #7, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

-- AODA assessment & follow-through with recommended treatment per agent 
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per agent
--Attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per agent
--Drug testing per agent
--to pay statutory costs
--100 hours community service

Days credit for time already served:  0  days

The Court approves transfer of Probation to Wausesha Co. 


recess: 2:57pm
BASED UPON the above Stipulation of the parties, it is HEREBY ORDERED that the rescheduling of the hearing is granted and the matter will be reshceduled for sentencing on September 8, 2016 at 2:30 pm
Sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
to Reschedule the presently scheduled Setencing hearingon 7-22-2016 at 10:30 am
Sentencing hearing on July 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Case called at 3:43pm [mo]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Ahmad indicates prepared to enter plea today; ask that sentencing be set out 45 days

recess: 3:45pm-- reconvene: 3:54PM

On ADA Teuber's request to submit an Amended Information:
--arguments given by ADA Teuber
--the Court grants ADA Teuber's request to submit an amended information
--Atty. Ahmad admits service and waives reading of the Amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3, #4, #5, #6, and #7 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 4:07pm

NEXT: Sentencing on 7/22/16 at 10:30am
to Produce and Transport the Defendant from Taycheedah Correctional on 6-2-2016 for proceedings in Branch 3
State's Proposed JI's - Reviewed by Court
State's Response to Court's Scheduling Order - Reviewed by Court
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by Defendant - Reviewed by Court
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made by the Defendant
State's Response to Court's Scheduling Order

Case called at 10:07am [mo]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Ahmad gives case update; requests additional status.

The Court schedules this case for FSSC and Jury Trial

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling
--one day Trial

The Court orders that the State is to apprise the Crime Lab of the scheduled date of Trial, and ensure an analyst is available for that scheduled Trial
The Court further orders that the State is to ensure that the Law Enforcement Agency distributes the items to the analyst by 2/26/16

The Court distributes its scheduling order
recess: 10:13am

NEXT: (1)FSSC on 5/23/16 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 6/2 OR 6/3/2016 at 8:30am
Rescheduling of the Pretrial Conference - approved
Request from DA's Office to reset the Pretrial Conference

Case called at 11:03am [mo]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

Ms. Holleman  waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no demand for speedy trial

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 11:08am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/27/16 at 9:40am    (2) Status Conference on 2/23/16 at 10:00am

Case called at 9:19am [mo]
[Scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Aneeq Ahmad does NOT appear, left message with the Court's JA indicating that he was ill.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court advises all parties that Atty. Ahmad is ill and will be unable to attend todays hearing.
The Court adjourns this hearing due to Atty. Ahmad's current unavailability.
The Court's JA will re-schedule this hearing to a mutually convenient time for the State and Atty. Ahmad.
The Court verifies Ms. Holleman's address.
recess: 9:21am

NEXT: JA to re-schedule Preliminary Hearing at a mutually convenient time for the State and Atty. Ahmad.

Case called at 1:07pm [mo]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised/ADA Wambach did prosecute Ms. Holleman. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

Atty. Ahmad indicates he has recently received Discovery from the State; requests a Preliminary hearing date and time. 
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.
recess:1:15pm

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 11/2/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 2:26pm [mo]
Defendant Melody A. Holleman in court with Attorney Aneeq Ahmad.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties on Count #3, Counts #1 and 

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--take all prescription medication as prescribed
--No Contact with Patsy Collins
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department today for booking
recess: 2:36pm

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/23/15 at 11:00am   (2) Status Conference on 10/5/15 at 1:00pm
